page.title: 10Buildings:World's End
page.content: As far as buildings are concerned, there has been little change for a very long time. most cottages are over 50 years old, some even older. 50 years ago they belonged to workers but now richer people buy these pretty cottages to live in:because of the M4 they can travel to London quickly. The church at Oare is a very fine village church. Its last restoration was in 1880 when it was cleaned up. The church now attracts hikers and sightseers. Many of the buildings in the area are listed. There are no hotels or youth hostels. At the moment, in Hampstead Norreys, there is a new village hall being built. This may house Cubs, Scouts and Guides which moved out some time ago. To sum it all up, the parish is very rural but not growing.
